stories.text:
The hiring market is weird right now which makes it difficult for job seekers to know what their value is. Companies try to control the spread of salary information so they have more leverage when negotiating. So my question is where are you, what is your role, and how much do you make?

I’m in the midwest United States earning $150k as a senior frontend engineer with 7 years of experience.
stories.title: Ask HN: What Is Your Salary?

stories.text:
I've found that the right mentors can radically accelerate your progress. While I was Google, this was fairly easy because of the strong internal network. However, it's more difficult now as a solopreneur.

Any ideas how I can find good mentors? I also have the related goal of becoming more "mentor-able".

For context, this [0] is what motivated my decision. I'm now starting a company [1] in the social good and self-development space.

[0] https://suketk.com/why-i-quit-google [1] https://themoai.org
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you find good mentors?
